intro: Platyopuntia, commonly known as the flat-tongue cactus, is a genus of cacti native to the Americas. These plants are characterized by their flat, paddle-shaped stems that store water, allowing them to thrive in arid environments. They typically produce clusters of yellow or white flowers during the spring and summer months. Platyopuntia species are often used in xeriscaping due to their low water requirements and ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are popular among cactus enthusiasts for their unique appearance.
